replies.body:
This club change is a _serious_ issue for the group of people I play with. We've used a chat channel for game coordination and setting up groups for ~4 years, and it contains anywhere between 40 and 100 people at all times of the day with a total group of like 200-300 that use it. Being able to just mass invite the channel when you want to start a game is super helpful for a plethora of reasons, and avoids the huge hassle of everyone having to individually manage their friends list and update it for the rotating group of people who are actively playing League.

If you force this change through, it effectively cuts our community in half if not worse and totally bars entry for new people. The cap on clubs needs to go way, way up especially if the number is for permanent members and not just total online members.

This is BY FAR the most important thing I've read in these comments, and needs to be brought to riot's attention ASAP. There are so many good MMO games that cripple themselves for no reason with stupidly small group caps like this, and it's just sad.

It also seems weird to me that, after all this pushing for player to find a group of friends to play with this season, over the soloq experience of old seasons. WHy not go all the way and opt for giant clans of non-toxic players grouping together, like old the old school big MMOs had? If the solution to toxicity is sticking with player you like, why not let good players create legit communities within league, rather than limit a group to the most somebody could know outside of the game? I honestly hope more of the community speaks out about this before it just becomes an accepted part of the whole clubs deal, because as long as they do, I have good faith riot do something sweet with it.

I completely agree. the 49 limit is just way too small. I am also part of a large chat group and we use the invite system to find like minded people to play with. This change would make this system completely useless. There is no point to have a limit on the size let alone one so very small. HUGE mistake.
I want Riot to make a revolutionary champion, like they did with Bard. Yeah, he sucks balls, but tis the idea that is important. I feel like every game is basically the same.
{{champion:432}} is actually good though.
{{champion:432}} is love. {{champion:432}} is life. It's a great feeling when you semi-carry every game with him.
{{champion:432}} is the definition of life. I main him too :P.

You know its bad when even Riot admits that fill = support.  Hopefully they will give players more options in the near future so we can choose more than two roles while not always having to play support if we pick fill.
Or choose something else and your primary and secondary role and sit there in the queue for god knows how long

There's a shortage of supports and that's entirely the players' fault tbh. It was the same in team builder, if you queued for support you got a match instantly, but if you queued for mid you'd be waiting a while.
